usefulItems: baking tray (20 x 30 cm), baking paper, silicone bread mat, wire rack, , oven, refrigerator
title: Damper with Golden Syrup Butter

ingredients.content: 450 g self-raising flour, plus extra for dusting
80 g unsalted butter, cut into pieces (2 cm)

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 200°C and line a baking tray with baking paper.
Place flour, butter, syrup and salt in mixing bowl then mix <b>10 sec/speed 6<b>.
Add water and milk then knead <b>20-25 sec/<b> until fully combined.
Tip dough out onto a lightly-floured work surface and shape into a round loaf (approx. 18 cm), then place on prepared baking tray.

Dust with a little extra flour, then bake for 25-30 minutes (200°C), or until damper is cooked through and sounds hollow when tapped on the underside. Transfer to a wire rack to cool. Clean mixing bowl.
Place golden syrup in mixing bowl and warm <b>30 sec/37°C/speed 1<b>.
Add butter and mix <b>30 sec/speed 3<b>. Transfer to an airtight container and place in fridge until ready to use.
Serve damper warm with golden syrup butter.

hintsAndTricks: Damper is traditionally wrapped in aluminium foil and cooked on the coals of an open fire. An outdoor pizza oven can also be used to bake damper.
To make your own butter to use in this recipe please refer to the recipe in The Basic Cookbook or the Everyday Cookbook.
